snippet: Some chefs have entered willingly into American social debates while others have found themselves unwittingly caught up in cultural wars.
abstract: Some chefs are being asked to make a stand on growing list of social issues, as position restaurants hold in American culture grows; some have entered willingly into American social debates while others have found themselves unwittingly caught up in cultural wars; South Carolina's concealed-weapons law turned Pete Matsko's pub into a battlefield after he posted a sarcastic sign banning concealed weapons, drawing online attacks and harassing phone calls.
lead_paragraph: Some chefs have entered willingly into American social debates while others have found themselves unwittingly caught up in cultural wars.

headline.main: Want Guns With That? Chefs Find Politics Hotter Than Kitchen
headline.print_headline: Want Guns With That? Chefs Find Politics Hotter Than Kitchen
